main event: On 22 July 1952, four air police and a staff sergeant reported seeing an unidentified flying object in Maxwell, Texas that climbed from 5,000 feet to 14,000 feet, hovered, and then flew south at high speed.
interesting points: The object was first seen at 5,000 feet with a bluish-green color, climbed rapidly in an arc to 14,000 feet, and hovered for one minute., The color changed to red as it dropped., There was no adequate explanation given for the object's behavior., The sighting involved multiple credible witnesses from the air police and Air Inspectors Office., This case was noted for insufficient follow-up despite its unusual characteristics.
sighted object: unidentified flying object that changed colors and exhibited unusual flight patterns
witness description: four air police and a staff sergeant from the Air Inspectors Office
